definition: irremediable/unmanageable/out of hand/hopeless
(negative prefix)/not/no
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
to ascend in light steps
once it gets started there's no stopping it
pinyin: yi1 fa1 bu4 ke3 shou1 shi5

sentences.english: Suitable for juicing and eating out of hand.
sentences.chinese: 适合榨汁吃一发不可收拾了。

sentences.english: On November 22 the fire in the San Gabriels was out of control.
sentences.chinese: 十一月二十二日，圣加百利山上的火势一发不可收拾。

sentences.english: Good for eating out of hand, excellent for juicing .
sentences.chinese: 很好吃不可收拾，为优秀的榨汁。

sentences.english: The first feeling of awe once overcome there was no holding me back.
sentences.chinese: 第一次的敬畏感克服之后，我感到一发不可收拾。

sentences.english: Liked to go up from this the network sends irremediable .
sentences.chinese: 自此喜欢上了网络并一发不可收拾。

sentences.english: Because of mismanagement, his business has gone to hell.
sentences.chinese: 因为管理不善，他的生意搞得一塌胡涂，不可收拾。

sentences.english: Become in this problem before irremediable, he thinks of a method to prevent.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题变得不可收拾之前，他想到一个方法阻止。

sentences.english: Top-down discrimination, such as a scourge, was out of control.
sentences.chinese: 自上而下的歧视如洪水猛兽，一发不可收拾。

sentences.english: With collective karma, when disaster occurs, the result will be devastating.
sentences.chinese: 众生共业，灾难若发生，真的就不可收拾了。

sentences.english: Things spiraled out of control when the singer got addicted to heroin.
sentences.chinese: 但是当他吸食海洛因上瘾之后事情变得一副不可收拾。

sentences.english: With such a pack of wolves running wild, no wonder the country's affairs are in chaos.
sentences.chinese: 国家有此一群虎狼，无怪乎国事不可收拾。

sentences.english: It just flows, like a river in flood.
sentences.chinese: 这种情况就如滔滔江水，一发不可收拾。

sentences.english: Good for eating out of hand or juicing.
sentences.chinese: 很好吃不可收拾或榨汁。

sentences.english: And things got out of hand.
sentences.chinese: 然后事情一发不可收拾了。

definition: irrevocable/the die is cast
irreversible
situation/existing state of affairs
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
too horrible to contemplate/unthinkable/inconceivable
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
(idiom) to become agitated/to get worked up
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
(in such circumstances) there will be no peace/one can never breathe easy
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to invite trouble
disaster/calamity
to go wrong/to get into trouble
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
